quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Mt. Everest
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nowadays, strauss. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The term Death Zone refers to what altitude?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: above 8,000 m

questions.question: What is the birthplace of Johann Strauss II, also known as The Waltz King?
In what European city are Piazza San Marco and Canale Grande located?
During Roman occupation, this city, popular nowadays as the Heaven of Romance, was called Lutetia.
Who is the first American to ascend all fourteen peaks over 8,000m without oxygen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Viesturs

questions.question: Has anyone landed an aircraft or helicopter on the summit of Mt. Everest?
This island in the Pacific Ocean is surrounded by a lagoon and a barrier reef.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bora Bora

questions.question: This city, situated on the River Vltava, is sometimes called the mother of cities, the city of a hundred spires and the golden city.
Part of the Southeast Ridge Route for climbing Mt. Everest is the Lhotse Face in which Camp III is established. There are 14 peaks over 8,000 meters. Where does Lhotse rank?
The city of Casablanca, which is the setting of the classic 1942 movie, starring Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman, is located in what African country?
What is considered to be the final major hurdle before reaching the summit of Mt. Everest from the South Col Route?

options.text: First Step, Second Step and Third Step

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hillary Step

questions.question: What islands are knows as “The beautiful garland in the Indian Ocean”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maldives Islands

questions.question: What popular tourist destination stands at the foot of the Maritime Alps?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monte Carlo

questions.question: What city is home of Broadway Theatre?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: In what country will you find the impressive Neuschwanstein Castle, which was the inspiration for Sleeping Beauty Castle at Disneyland Park?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and Spain
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, formosa, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official language spoken on the territory of Spain?
Spain does not share a border with which one of these countries?
This island is one of Indonesias 33 provinces.
This island country whose capital is Nicosia is the third-largest Mediterranean island.
Name the largest of the Canary Islands.
What is the name of the capital and largest city of Spain?
What island, located in the North Pacific Ocean, is also known as the Big Island?
This European island is situated in the North Atlantic Ocean, south of the Arctic Circle. Its largest city is Reykjavik.
This island, located in the Caribbean Sea, is the largest island of an archipelago called Greater Antilles. The city of Havana is located on it.
This is the sixth largest island in the world, and the largest island that is entirely in Indonesia.
What is the meaning of the name of Spain according to a popular theory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: When is the national holiday called Hispanic Day celebrated annually in Spain?
This island, sometimes called island of inspiration, is part of a very large country, and has a unique fauna.
Valletta is the capital city of this island country in the Mediterranean.
This island, also known as Formosa, is the largest island of the Republic of China.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Eilat and Israel
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, eilat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Peace Treaty between Jordan and Israel was signed near Eilat. In what year did this happen?
When was the city of Eilat founded?
What is the population of Eilat according to the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics end of 2004 census?
What are the colors of the three vertical stripes on the national flag of Spain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, yellow, red

questions.question: Which city is a sister city to Eilat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles, California

questions.question: What is the main ingredient of the traditional Spanish dish paella?
Which is the major source of revenue for the Eilat area?
In 1967, Egypt effectively blockaded Eilat by closing this area to Israel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Straits of Tiran

questions.question: In which section of Israel is Eilat located?
What best describes the climate of Eilat?

options.text: Humid and hot  summers and humid and cool winters
Humid, hot summers and dry, cool winters
Hot, dry summers and humid, cool winters

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot and dry all year

questions.question: Which of these popular musicians was not born in Spain?
Israels major airport is located near Eilat.
Spanish painter and sculptor Pablo Picasso is known for co-founding what art movement?
What is the title of the national anthem of Spain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Royal March

questions.question: Which four countries can be seen from Eilat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel, Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Niagara Falls and Water
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nicknames, blondin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where does the Freedom Trail begin and end?

options.text: Boston Public Gardens, Old North Church

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Common, Charlestown Navy Yard

questions.question: When was the Skylon Tower, Niagaras most famous landmark, built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the 1960s

questions.question: Which U.S. state is nicknamed The Natural State?
Name the smallest of the three waterfalls that make up the Niagara Falls.

options.text: There are only two waterfalls that make up the Niagara Falls.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bridal Veil Falls

questions.question: How long is the crest of the American Falls if measured along the jagged lip of the falls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 950  feet  (290 m)

questions.question: On October 24, 1901, Annie Edson Taylor became the first person to go over the Niagara Falls in a barrel as a publicity stunt. How old was she at the time?

Around the year 1859, Jean-François Blondin crossed the gorge below Niagara Falls on a tightrope 1100 feet (335 m) long, 160 feet (50 m) above the water. He made this accomplishment several times including which of the following theatrical variations?

options.text: He carried his manager on his back.
He sat down midway while he cooked and ate an omelette.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the famous Niagara boat called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maid of the Mist

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of the water of the Niagara River flows over the Horseshoe Falls?
The flow of the water over the American Falls was completely blocked from June to November in what year?
What U.S. state is nicknamed Land of Infinite Variety?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Dakota

questions.question: What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beaver State

questions.question: What event related to the Niagara Falls occurred on March 29th 1848?

options.text: The flow of water over both falls stopped to the point where people could walk around the riverbed.
The flow of water was stopped completely over the American Falls.
A third, much smaller waterfall was discovered.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The flow of water over both falls stopped to the point where people could walk around the riverbed.

questions.question: The cities of Niagara Falls, Ontario and Niagara Falls, New York are connected by three bridges. Which of them is the oldest one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whirlpool Rapids Bridge

questions.question: Which of these nicknames has been given to the U.S. state of Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland of America

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Slovakia and Slovenia
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, rhode, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Independence State is one of the nicknames of this U.S. state.
The nickname Queen State has been given to this U.S. state.
The Danube river flows through many Central European countries. Which of these statements concerning Slovakia and Slovenia is true?

options.text: The Danube does not flow through either of the 2 countries.
The Danube originates in Slovakia and then enters Slovenia.
Of the two countries, only Slovakia has Danubian banks.
The Danube originates in Slovenia and then flows through Slovakia.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of the two countries, only Slovakia has Danubian banks.

questions.question: Which of these statements regarding Slovakia and Slovenia is true?

options.text: Only Slovakia is an Alpine country.
Only Slovenia is an Alpine country.
None of them is an Alpine country.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Only Slovenia is an Alpine country.

questions.question: What is the capital of Slovakia?
Which statement concerning Slovakia and Slovenia is true?

options.text: Both countries have access to the Black Sea.
Slovenia has access to the Adriatic Sea.
Slovakia has access to the Baltic Sea.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slovenia has access to the Adriatic Sea.

questions.question: Which of these nicknames has been given to the U.S. state of Illinois?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corn State

questions.question: What is the capital of Slovenia?
This U.S. state was nicknamed Vacationland, and the nickname is used on license plates.
What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ocean State

questions.question: Which U.S. state is nicknamed The Cowboy State?
Which country borders both Slovenia and Slovakia?
Which former empire were both Slovenia and Slovakia part of?
Slovakia and Slovenia joined the European Union on the same day (May 1, 2004). Which of them was first to accept the euro currency?

options.text: None of them has accepted the EURO currency.
Both did on the day of their accession to the EU.

questions.question: Which country, Slovakia or Slovenia, used to be part of Yugoslavia?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Switzerland and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The establishment of the Democratic Peoples Republic of Korea in this year set the official beginning of North Koreas history.
Which of these is the capital and the largest city in North Korea?
What is the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the largest city in Switzerland?
What type of climate does North Korea have?
What mountain covers about 65% of the territory of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Alps

questions.question: Which of these seas surrounds the Korean Peninsula, in the northern part of which North Korea is located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the main ingredient of the traditional Swiss dish Rosti?
Which of these famous philosophers was of Swiss descent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

questions.question: What language is adopted as official for the territory of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the unofficial national motto of Switzerland?

options.text: One for all, all for one

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One for all, all for one

questions.question: Which country, Slovakia or Slovenia, borders a country that did not join the European Union in the period 1951-2007?

options.text: Only Slovakia borders a country that did not join the EU during this period.
Both share borders only with countries that became EU members during this period.
Both share borders with countries that did not became EU members during this period.
Only Slovenia borders a country that did not join the EU during this period.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both share borders with countries that did not became EU members during this period.

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swiss Psalm

questions.question: Switzerland is often associated with this product which is produced at the highest quality in the country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What design is depicted on the national flag of Switzerland?
